ai-ud3.10:1.2_0: At one time, when he was first awakened, the Buddha was staying near Uruvelā at the root of a Bodhi tree on the bank of the river Nerañjara at the foot of a Bodhi tree.
ai-ud3.10:1.3_0: Now at that time the Buddha was sitting cross-legged for seven days without moving, experiencing the bliss of freedom.
ai-ud3.10:2.1_0: When seven days had passed, the Buddha emerged from that state of immersion and surveyed the world with the eye of a Buddha.
ai-ud3.10:2.2_0: He saw sentient beings tormented with many torments, and burning with many fevers
ai-ud3.10:2.3_0: born of greed, hate, and delusion.
ai-ud3.10:3.1_0: Knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud3.10:4.2_0: overcome by contact, speaks of disease as the self.
ai-ud3.10:4.3_0: For whatever it thinks it is, it turns out to be something else.
ai-ud3.10:5.1_0: The world is attached to continued existence, overcome by continued existence,
ai-ud3.10:5.2_0: taking pleasure only in continued existence, yet it becomes something else.
ai-ud3.10:5.3_0: What it enjoys, that is the fear;
ai-ud3.10:5.4_0: what it fears, that is the suffering.
ai-ud3.10:5.5_0: But this spiritual life is led
ai-ud3.10:5.6_0: in order to give up continued existence.
ai-ud3.10:6.1_0: Of the ascetics and brahmins who say that through continued existence one is freed from continued existence, none are themselves freed from continued existence, I say.
ai-ud3.10:6.2_0: Of the ascetics and brahmins who say that through annihilation of existence one escapes from continued existence, none have themselves escaped from continued existence, I say.
ai-ud3.10:7.1_0: For this suffering originates dependent on all attachment. With the ending of all grasping there is no origination of suffering.
ai-ud3.10:7.3_0: Mired in all sorts of ignorance, beings in love with being are not released from continued existence.
ai-ud3.10:7.4_0: Whatever states of continued existence there are—everywhere, all over—all are impermanent, suffering, and perishable.
ai-ud3.10:8.1_0: In this way one seeing with right wisdom
ai-ud3.10:8.3_0: gives up craving for continued existence,
ai-ud3.10:8.4_0: while not look forward to ending existence.
ai-ud3.10:8.5_0: Extinguishment comes from the ending of all cravings;
ai-ud3.10:8.6_0: fading away and cessation with nothing left over.
ai-ud3.10:9.2_0: for that mendicant extinguished without grasping.
ai-ud3.10:9.3_0: Victorious in battle, such a one has defeated Māra;
ai-ud3.10:9.4_0: they’ve gone beyond all states of existence.”
ai-ud3.10:9.6_0: The third sub-chapter on Nanda is finished.
